articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Remodeled Phyongchon Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Remodeled Phyongchon Revolutionary Site
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site rebuilt into an eternal treasure of the Songun revolution.
					 The Phyongchon Revolutionary Site is a historic place associated with the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, who chose the site for the first arsenal in the liberated country and paved an untrodden path for the munitions industry.
					
					 Enjoying a panoramic view of the site, Kim Jong Un noted that the President came to the Phyongchon plain in October 1945, seventy years ago to choose the site for a munitions factory.
					
					 He went round a mosaic depicting the images of the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and a monument to their field guidance, submachine-gun performance test ground and firing range and the revolutionary museum.
					
					 He said with high appreciation that every part of the site has been redintegrated in the principle of historicism and its education compound and greening are neat and admirable.
					
					 The education in the Songun (military-first) idea occupies an important part in the Party's ideological work, he said, adding that the Phyongchon Revolutionary Site has a very important role in conveying the immortal Songun revolutionary exploits performed by the peerlessly great persons of Mt. Paektu and encouraging the servicepersons and civilians to remain loyal to the Party's Songun leadership.
					
					 He advanced such tasks for operating the site as matters of displaying a photo of the President test-firing a submachine gun at the shooting range, intensifying the work to discover historic data, meticulously organizing the visits to the site, steadily raising the ability of its lecturers and conducting a brisk itinerant lecture and bettering the environment of the site.
					
					 The Phyongchon Revolutionary Site is just a native place of the Songun arms, he said, adding: Every gun, produced thanks to the tireless efforts of the President, has formed a forest of arms defending the Party and the revolution, the country and its people and the historic gun report made by him at the site turned the DPRK into a powerful nuclear weapons state ready to detonate self-reliant A-bomb and H-bomb to reliably defend its sovereignty and the dignity of the nation.
					
					 If we struggle in the same spirit with which the workers produced submachine guns by their own efforts just after the liberation of the country when everything was in need, we can further build up our country into a powerful one no enemy dare to provoke, he said, stressing the need to steadily put big efforts on the development of the country's munitions industry associated with devoted efforts of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Accompanying him were Hwang Pyong So, Yun Tong Hyon, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil and Jang Chang Ha.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Premier Pak Pong Ju made field survey of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex. 
					 After looking round various places of the complex, the premier encouraged workers in tapping operation and stressed the need to earnestly learn from the fighting spirit and stamina of the preceding generations who upheld the party through increased steel production under the slogan of the party "Iron and the machine are the king of industry!"
					
					 A consultative meeting held on the spot underscored the need for the relevant units to take measures for fully ensuring iron ore, coal and electricity, keenly aware of the importance of boosting the iron and steel production.
					
					 Earlier, he inspected the work in the field of agriculture and discussed the issue to produce efficient farm machines suited to the actual conditions of the country and increase the production of organic composite fertilizer.

articles.title: Greetings to United Malays National Organization of Malaysia
articles.content:
Greetings to United Malays National Organization of Malaysia
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) on Thursday sent a congratulatory message to the Congress of the United Malays National Organization of Malaysia (UMNOM).
					 The message said that the WPK is pleased that the UMNOM has registered big successes in the work for the national unity and socio-economic development under the slogan "One Malaysia".
					
					 Expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the WPK and the UMNOM would grow stronger in the future, too, it sincerely wished the UMNOM success in the work of its congress.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Leaves for Angola, Mozambique
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Leaves for Angola, Mozambique
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation headed by Minister of Public Health Kang Ha Guk left here on Thursday to visit Angola and Mozambique.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Here
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Here
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Energy of Russia led by Vice-Minister Anton Inyutsin arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: Delegation of Russian Ministry of Energy Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Delegation of Russian Ministry of Energy Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Energy of Russia visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill Thursday.
					 Members of the delegation laid bouquets before the statues of the great leaders before paying tribute to them.

articles.title: Participants in 3rd National Conference of Financial and Banking Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Participants in 3rd National Conference of Financial and Banking Officials Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Participants in the 3rd National Conference of Financial and Banking Officials visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun on Thursday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The visitors paid tribute to the great leaders before their statues at the palace.
					
					 In the halls where Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state they made deep bows to them.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the great leaders received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Staff Members of Romanian Embassy Visit Pyongyang Primary School No. 4
articles.content:
Staff Members of Romanian Embassy Visit Pyongyang Primary School No. 4
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Gheorghe Cioaca, charge d'affaires ad interim, and staff members of the Romanian embassy here Thursday visited Pyongyang Primary School No. 4 in the run-up to the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 They looked round the room for the education in the revolutionary history housing photos and mementoes. 
					
					 They went round different education facilities such as a library and room for nature education before enjoying an art performance given by pupils.

articles.title: Workers in DPRK Turn Out in Innovation Drive
articles.content:
Workers in DPRK Turn Out in Innovation Drive
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- In hearty response to the appeal made by the workers of the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex to greet the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) with high political enthusiasm and unprecedented labor achievements, all other workers in the DPRK have turned out in a drive for making constant innovations on every front of economic construction.
					 A great production upswing is now witnessed at metal, power, coal and other industrial establishments across the country.
					
					 Kim Chang Sok, director of a department of the Ministry of Coal Industry, told KCNA: The appeal made by the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex workers inspires the colliers to the campaign for increased production. True to the WPK's intention, we will further increase the coal production by introducing the advanced mining methods.
					
					  Such strong will for production upswing can be felt at such industrial fields as railway transport, light industry, machine-building industry and fishery.
					
					 All the workers in the country are working great innovations in production and construction, with their steadfast resolve to speed up the building of an economic giant.

articles.title: Standard-bearer of Juche-based Art
articles.content:
Standard-bearer of Juche-based Art
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The army and people of the DPRK now recollect with deep emotion the history of the State Merited Chorus, upon receiving the news that the Chorus and the Moranbong Band are on a friendship visit to China.
					 The Chorus has served as a bugler of the Songun (military-first) revolution. It is a famous art troupe of the DPRK which has made praiseworthy contributions to the advance of the socialist cause and human history of literature and art.
					
					 The immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Il Sung" was the first song it put on the stage of its premiere. 
					
					 During the hard-fought Fatherland Liberation War (1950-1953), the Chorus encouraged soldiers to annihilate the invaders. After the war, it instilled into the minds of the army and people the spirit of devotedly defending the leader by successfully representing "Cantata to Marshal Kim Il Sung".
					
					 Even in the period of the Arduous March, the forced march, it conducted a brisk performing activities to arouse all the servicepersons and civilians to the defence of socialism with the immortal revolutionary hymn "Song of General Kim Jong Il" and other revolutionary and militant songs.
					
					 In his lifetime, leader Kim Jong Il used to say the Chorus greatly encouraged him and its performances represented what he wanted to say to the people.
					
					 Now, under the wise guidance of supreme leader Kim Jong Un, the Chorus plays an important role in inspiring all the people to the general offensive for final victory with martial strains of such revolutionary songs as "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu" and "Let's Not Abandon Revolutionary Faith Though One May Die".

articles.title: Popular Band Spearheading Arts of Songun Korea
articles.content:
Popular Band Spearheading Arts of Songun Korea
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The Moranbong Band is an art troupe beloved by all citizens of the DPRK for its vivacious and peculiar performances.
					 The band, which gave its premiere in July Juche 101 (2012), has put on the stage colorful numbers, thus making contributions to encouraging all the people to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Its performances are characterized by highly charged atmosphere, rich sound of music and decorative stage settings and lightings, all of which are rocking the audience.
					
					 Each number the band put on the stage is vibrant with the idea of the Workers' Party of Korea and the spirit of the times, while vividly showing the life and emotion of the Korean people.
					
					 The innovative manner of creating works makes the band emerge as a fashionable one with great creative power, a precious art troupe representing and spearheading the arts of Songun Korea.
					
					 The DPRK people sincerely hope that the band will achieve great successes during its friendship visit to China.

articles.title: World Media Give Wide Publicity to State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band
articles.content:
World Media Give Wide Publicity to State Merited Chorus and Moranbong Band
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Foreign media Tuesday and Wednesday reported about the friendship visit to China by the State Merited Chorus and the Moranbong Band of the DPRK.
					 Xinhua News said that the Moranbong Band and the State Merited Chorus, famous art troupes of DPRK, left for China to perform there, adding:
					
					 They were seen off by Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, and Li Jinjun, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and other officials.
					
					 Kim Ki Nam in his conversation with Li Jinjun noted that the DPRK and China are the friendly neighbors, stressing that boosting exchange and cooperation in the cultural field is beneficial for deepening mutual understanding between the peoples of the two countries and consolidating the foundation of their friendship.
					
					 He hoped that the China visit by the chorus and band and their performances there would provide an important occasion in promoting the development of the DPRK-China relations and boosting exchange and cooperation between the two countries in the field concerned.
					
					 Li Jinjun said that the DPRK side's dispatch of prestigious art organizations to China to perform there is of weighty significance in linking the feelings of the peoples of the two countries and deepening mutual understanding.
					
					 Noting that the Chinese side is attaching great importance to their China visit and performances, Li expressed hope that they would make a positive contribution to boosting exchange and cooperation between China and the DPRK in culture and various other fields and promoting stable and sound development of bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					 At a press conference held in Beijing a spokesperson for the Chinese Foreign Ministry referred to the friendly visit to China by the chorus and band of the DPRK. 
					
					 The spokesperson said:
					
					 The DPRK is a close neighbor of China. China is ready to steadily develop the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK. We are sure that these relations are favorable for peace and stability of the two countries and the region. 
					
					 TASS reported:
					
					 The DPRK's popular Moranbong Band left Pyongyang to perform in China. 
					
					 Korean artistes' performances would help deepen the friendship and boost the cultural and art exchanges between the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 The State Merited Chorus, the very experienced creating group in the DPRK, also left for China together with the Moranbong Band.
					
					 The Kyodo News said:
					
					 The DPRK's musicians including the members of the Moranbong Band, the most popular female band in north Korea, left for China by train. 
					
					  Li Jinjun said at a railway station in Pyongyang that China is very pleased with the news of their visit and Liu Yunshan noted it attaches great importance to their visit.
					
					 The Moranbong Band is popular among the people for its familiar music and gorgeousness.
					
					 The State Merited Chorus is a male chorus that has represented the DPRK since the era of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Nihon Keizai Shimbun, Tokyo Shimbun, Mainichi Shimbun and NHK of Japan reported in detail about the DPRK's above-said art troupes' friendship visit to China.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Urged to Step Down
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Urged to Step Down
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- An editorial was posted on the south Korean internet newspaper Minjok Ilbo on Dec. 8 on the lapse of 600 days since the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The truth about the disaster has not yet been probed and no one owns responsibility for it, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 The "government" failed to rescue those it could save. It walked off, shadowed and threatened the bereaved families demanding the probe into the truth about the disaster.
					
					 Proper probe into the truth about the disaster and punishment of those responsible for it are impossible under the present regime.
					
					 There will be no probe into the truth unless the present regime steps down.

articles.title: S. Korean Religionists Protest against Police Action to Suppress KCTU Chairman
articles.content:
S. Korean Religionists Protest against Police Action to Suppress KCTU Chairman
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- South Korean religionists strongly protested against the police's action to arrest the chairman of the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) taking refuge in Jogye Temple, according to the south Korean CBS. 
					 The fascist police authorities announced that they would hurl police forces into the temple to arrest the chairman unless he voluntarily appears at police station by Wednesday afternoon. 
					
					 In this regard the spokesman for Jogye Order held an emergency press conference. 
					
					 He said that the threat to hurl police forces into Jogye Temple is not just to arrest the KCTU chairman by force but to trample down Buddhism by government power.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution Blocks Probe into Sinking of Warship "Cheonan"
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution Blocks Probe into Sinking of Warship "Cheonan"
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The south Korean prosecution authorities perpetrated such fascist action as demanding three years in prison for Sin Sang Chol, former member of the joint team for investigating the sinking of warship "Cheonan", at the trial held at the Seoul Central District Court on Dec. 7, according to the south Korean "Newsis".
					 Sin made it clear in his dozens of writings and speeches in two and half months after the sinking incident that the warship "Cheonan" sank after it ran against a rock or collided with a submarine.
					
					 Much upset by this, the prosecution authorities made desperate efforts to punish him.
					
					 This is a revelation of the sinister plot to block the probe into the truth behind the sinking incident.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Assailed 
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration held a press conference in Seoul to denounce the authorities' anti-DPRK "human rights" racket on Dec. 8, according to the south Korean online paper Thongil News. 
					 The organization in a press release bitterly slammed the political camp for having decided to clear the "bill on human rights in the north" as well as other bills during the regular session of the "National Assembly". 
					
					 Speakers at the press conference voiced strong opposition to the enactment of the "law on human rights in the north", demanding the ruling and opposition parties withdraw the bill at once and give up their attempt to enact it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by Nigerian Organization on Its Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Letter Posted by Nigerian Organization on Its Website
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The full text of the letter sent by Marshal Kim Jong Un to the participants in the 4th Conference of Frontrunners of the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement "Let Us Bring About a Fundamental Turn in the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement in Line with the Demands of the Developing Revolution" was posted by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on its website on December 3.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Khabarovsk, Russia on December 4.
					 Alexander Fedosov, chairman of the Russia-Korea Friendship Association of Khabarovsk Territory who doubles as deputy prime minister of the Khabarovsk Territory Government, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in France
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in France
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A committee for remembering leader Kim Jong Il was formed in France on November 30.
					 Guy Dupre, president of the France-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events to praise the exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Peru
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Peru
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian remembrance committee for commemorating the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il was formed in Lima on December 4.
					 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events including a remembrance meeting and film show on the above-said occasion.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Russian, Tajik Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Russian, Tajik Personages
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held by the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia and the Communist Party of Tajikistan on Dec. 2 and 3 on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The director of the International Affairs Department of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia said in a report that Kim Jong Il was a peerless statesman who safeguarded socialism by pursuing the great Songun politics.
					
					 The director went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Il was a great man who implemented the line of independence in politics, self-support in economy and self-reliance in national defence, turning the DPRK into a power which no enemy dares provoke. 
					
					 He was a father of the people who dedicated himself to them, regarding it as his motto to believe in them as in Heaven and always finding himself among them. 
					
					 The DPRK has adhered to the independent stand and demonstrated its might as a power. This would have been unthinkable without the exploits of Kim Jong Il who was possessed of matchless grit and courage. 
					
					 The chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan said:
					
					 Kim Jong Il is always remembered not only by the Korean people but by the world progressives as a great leader.
					
					 He developed in depth the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He frustrated every move of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK and firmly defended socialism with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Thanks to his wise leadership, the DPRK emerged a political, ideological and military power which even the U.S. dares not provoke.

articles.title: Swiss Organizations Urge U.S. to Opt for Dialogue with DPRK for Concluding Peace Treaty
articles.content:
Swiss Organizations Urge U.S. to Opt for Dialogue with DPRK for Concluding Peace Treaty
 Pyongyang, December 10 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Dec. 4 rebuking the U.S. for shunning the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The spokesman for the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea in a statement on Dec. 2 again urged the U.S. to conclude a peace treaty.
					
					 The U.S. is persistently insisting that the DPRK should dismantle its nuclear weapons, to begin with, and unilaterally disarm itself, an unreasonable and unacceptable demand.
					
					 The U.S. is also talking volumes about the denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula and resumption of the six-party talks.
					
					 However, the two issues-- conclusion of a peace treaty and denuclearization-- should not be mixed with each other.
					
					 Only when the Armistice Agreement is replaced with a peace treaty and an end is put to the U.S. hostile policy towards the DPRK, can other problems be resolved.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to abandon its unreasonable stand, stop employing a sleight of hand and opt for dialogue with the DPRK for the conclusion of a peace treaty.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Phyongchon
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige lugar de interes historico-revolucionario de Phyongchon
Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el Lugar de Interes Historico-Revolucionario de Phyongchon, reconstruido excelentemente como eterno patrimonio de la revolucion del Songun.
					El Lugar transmite las indelebles hazanas de los grandes Lideres quienes tomaron un solar de la primera fabrica de armas en la tierra patria liberada y emprendieron a la cabeza un camino desconocido de la industria armamentista.
					
					Contemplando el panorama del Lugar, el Mariscal recordo que en octubre de 1945, el Presidente Kim Il Sung salio a la llanura de Phyongchon donde determino un terreno para la fabrica de armas y anadio que ya pasaron 70 anos desde aquel entonces.
					
					Recorrio el mural de mosaicos con imagenes de los grandes hombres sin pares del monte Paektu, el monumento en memoria de la visita de orientacion, el lugar de ensayo de funciones de fusil ametrallador, el otro de tiro de fusil ametrallador y el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria.
					
					Dijo que el lugar de ensayo de funciones de fusil ametrallador y otros sitios del Lugar mantienen el estado original conforme a los principios historicistas y evaluo el hecho de que la explanada de educacion fue acondicionada excelentemente y el area verde fue bien formada.
					
					En las labores ideologicas de nuestro partido, la educacion en la idea de Songun deviene un trabajo primordial, destaco el Mariscal y continuo que este lugar historico tiene un importantisimo deber en transmitir eternamente  las inmortales hazanas de los grandes Hombres del monte Paektu sin pares realizadas en la revolucion del Songun y estimular al ejercito y el pueblo a apoyar con fidelidad la direccion del partido mediante el Songun.
					
					Presento las tareas que se presentan en la administracion del Lugar, entre otras el problema de colocar en el lugar de tiro la foto del Presidente realizando el tiro de ensayo del fusil ametrallador, el de profundizar mas el trabajo de descubrimientos de datos historicos, el de organizar bien la visita al lugar, mejorar sin cesar el nivel de trabajo de las conferenciantes, realizar dinamicamente las clases ambulantes y arreglar bien el ambiente del contorno.
					
					Los fusiles fabricados uno a otro gracias a los incansables esfuerzos del Presidente formaron hoy un bosque de armas que defienden el partido y la revolucion, la patria y el pueblo. Agrego que gracias a los disparos historicos del Presidente de aquel dia, la patria pudo convertirse en un poderoso pais poseedor de armas nucleares capaz de detonar la bomba nuclear y la de hidrogeno que pueden defender fidedignamente la soberania del pais y la dignidad de la nacion, dijo y continuo que el Lugar de Interes Historico-Revolucionario de Phyongchon es igual a la tierra natal de las fuerzas armadas de Songun.
					
					Si trabajan con el espiritu desplegado en el periodo posterior a la liberacion cuando aunque todo estaba muy dificil fabricaron con las propias fuerzas el fusil ametrallador es posible consolidar mas la patria como una potencia a que cualesquier enemigos no se atreven a atentar, menciono y enfatizo en la necesidad de seguir prestando la gran atencion al fortalecimiento y el desarrollo de la industria belica impregnada de los esfuerzos del Presidente y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Le acompanaron Hwang Pyong So, Yun Tong Hyon, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil y Jang Chang Ha.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju recorre Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju recorre Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae
Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea Pak Pong Ju se cercioro en el terreno de las gestiones del Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae.
					 Despues de recorrer varios lugares del Complejo, el premier estimulo a los fundidores en la operacion de colada y subrayo la necesidad de aprender el espiritu de lucha de las generaciones anteriores que vinieron defendiendo el Partido con la produccion de acero bajo la consigna "!El hierro y la maquina son los reyes de la industria!"
					
					  En la reunion de consulta efectuada en el terreno se debatieron los problemas de medidas para que las unidades relacionadas aseguren suficientemente los minerales de hierro, el carbon y la electricidad teniendo presente de la importancia del aumento de la produccion de materiales de hierro y acero.
					
					  Con anterioridad, Pak se entero en el terreno del trabajo de la rama agricola y consulto los problemas para fabricar las maquinas agricolas eficientes adecuadas a la realidad de Corea y aumentar la produccion del abono compuesto organico.

articles.title: Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de RPDC hacia Angola y Mozambique
articles.content:
Parte de Pyongyang delegacion de RPDC hacia Angola y Mozambique
Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Salio el dia 10 de esta capital la delegacion gubernamental de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea encabezada por Kang Ha Guk, ministro de Salud Publica, para visitar Angola y Mozambique.

articles.title: Delegacion de Rusia rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Delegacion de Rusia rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 10 de diciembre (ACNC) -- La delegacion del Ministerio de Energia de Rusia rindio el dia 10 homenaje al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il ante sus estatuas de bronce erguidas en la colina Mansu tras depositar los ramos de flores.
